numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed a sharp difference between the percentage of adults and the percentage of young adults who think that the world is becoming better.
2. The poll selected 21 countries.
3. In 18 of the 21 countries, adults have a more negative view than young adults.
4. I think that this discrepancy happens because adults older than 40 years have more knowledge and experience about how the world has changed over the past half-century.
5. Young adults have only witnessed change over the past one or two decades.
6. Older adults usually have more visual opinions about whether the world is getting better with each generation.
7. Older adults usually have more tangible opinions about whether the world is getting better with each generation.
8. In the contemporary world, we face many crises.
9. The Ebola outbreak is a public health concern.
10. Exacerbating HIV/AIDS epidemics are public health concerns.
11. The worldwide COVID-19 pandemic is a public health concern.
12. There are wars and unrests in the world.
13. There is fighting in Afghanistan.
14. There are skirmishes in Afghanistan.
15. There is fighting in Iraq.
16. There are skirmishes in Iraq.
17. There is fighting in Ukraine.
18. There are skirmishes in Ukraine.
19. There are political mayhems in Myanmar.
20. There are political mayhems in Egypt.
21. There are political mayhems in Hong Kong.
22. There are political mayhems in Algeria.
23. There are political mayhems in Pakistan.
24. There are political mayhems in Afghanistan.
25. There are political mayhems in Iran.
26. There are political mayhems in Iraq.
27. There are political mayhems in the United States.
28. There are political mayhems in the United Kingdom.
29. The number of terrorist attacks increases worldwide.
30. The number of hate crimes increases worldwide.
31. Some terrorist attacks happen in developing countries.
32. Some terrorist attacks happen in developed countries.
33. Some hate crimes happen in developing countries.
34. Some hate crimes happen in developed countries.
35. The number of natural disasters increases.
36. Global warming causes natural disasters.
37. The cumulative over-exploitation of the environment causes natural disasters.
38. Forest fires are natural disasters.
39. Some forest fires happen in the Amazon rainforest.
40. Some forest fires happen in the Australian desert.
41. Some forest fires happen in Taiwan.
